Hmm... it seems that you're walking home on a fine day and you find a shining rock.
"What is this," you say.
You walk up to the shining rock and you reach out for it.
When you touch the rock, it feels cold and steely.
"Where the hell did this shit come from," you question.
You shrug and grab the rock, place it in your pocket, and run home.
You reach your house and go to your room.
You then feel a burning sensation in your pocket.
"What the FU-?"
*BOOOOOOM!*
You fly back from the shockwave of energy, your clothes also have been burned off which leaves you naked on the floor.
"OH MY GOD," you exclaim. "What the hell happened to me!?"

What did happen to you?

Seems like you fainted.
When you open your eyes, it's already nighttime and you're laying on your bed.

Then you feel something in your mouth.
You put your fingers toward your teeth and feel something sharp, it turns out that they're fangs.
"Holy shit, I have fangs," you say.
Then you have that sensation, that feeling, you ARE hungry.
You plot who to eat and think of some vulnerable targets.

111.content:
You're hungry, REALLY HUNGRY, more so than you've ever been in your entire life. "God, I need a snack!" You exclaim, leaping from your bed.
That's when you notice that something is amiss. Rather than landing landing on the floor about a foot away from the side of your bed as you normally would you slammed face first into the wall, your legs seemingly much stronger than they had been before. "What the..." You stood you and took a few steps back, rubbing your sore nose as you did. Something caught your eye... or rather failed to. "Huh?!" The mirror on your closet did not show you, despite the fact that you were standing right in front of it. Instead you saw only your clothes, your shorts, shirt, and socks seemingly hovering in the air in the reflection. You stare into the mirror for some time, moving and watching your clothes rise and fall in time with your motions.
Wait. Super strength? Fangs? Immense hunger? No reflection? "Holy shit, am I a vampire?!" You suppose that there are a few ways test that out. The first thing you do is head to the kitchen, being careful not to awaken any of your relatives as you moved through the house. When you arrived at the kitchen you grabbed the first morsel of food that was within reach and brought it to your lips without pause. You took a humongous bite out of it, a granny smith apple by the look of it. Almost immediately you are forced to spit it out as it tastes of nothing but ashes, hot ashes at that! You drop it onto the counter and fling the cupboard open, grabbing a box of cereal and tearing the top open.
The next twenty minutes was spent tearing into anything and everything you could get your hands on. The cereal tasted of ash, the chips tasted of ash, the tortillas tasted of ash, the soup, the ham, the ice cream, ashes, dust, embers! You left your kitchen a mess, too ravenous to care about the wreckage you left behind you. You sprinted out of the door, knowing exactly whom you were going to feed off of.
Your neighbor Rose was three things. Big, beautiful, and a total bitch! She stood in at 5'11", taller than even you were (though it was only by an inch). She had fair skin and blond hair, looking like some sort of nordic princess with eyes as blue as the summer sky and defined cheekbones to match them. She also had great big... assets, and huge tracts of land! All of this superficial loveliness couldn't hide her bitter soul, which is why no man has ever been able to wed her since her first husband died almost a decade ago, when she was just 23 and you were just eight. She was rude to everyone she ever met and had an air of arrogance that repulsed even the most desperate of suitors. She never seemed to smile, and had only one annoyed tone of voice. She lived across the street in a sizable mansion (her deceased husband was a multimillionaire, and had a life insurance policy that ensured that no one in his family line would have to work for generations to come) with her two daughters, the sixteen year old Violet and the fifteen year old Daisy. She lived vicariously through them, forcing them into any competition, activity, and event she could with no regard for their needs. If anyone deserve to be drained, it's her!
You reached her front door and began banging on it as loudly as you could. You were panting now, practically salivating with hunger. A loud swear echoes through the night air, followed by rummaging and then stomping. After long several seconds the door is flung open, and you are face to face with Rose and her friends Smith and Wesson. "WHO THE FUCK KNOCKS AT THIS HOUR?!?!" She looks down at you, here eyes filled with a potent mixture of rage and confusion. "WHAT DO YOU FUCKING WANT BOY?!?!" She roars, cocking the gun in your face like a lunatic.
"Whoa! Put the gun down!" You say in a panicked tone, your eyes fixing on hers.
"WHY SHOULD I, I SHOULD... WHY..." Her words began slurring together, her grip loosening as well. You watched with bewilderment as something began to leave her eyes, something... human. You continued to stare at her, not knowing what was going on. Then it hit you, you were mesmerizing her! This was awesome! "Put the gun down." You command her, your stance relaxing.
"...you... can't... uh... o... Okay." She said empty mindedly, her eyes now fully dilated and dull. She haphazardly dropped the revolver, standing mutely as she awaited new commands.
"Good girl, now let's go inside!" You chirp.
"Okay." Was her only response. She stepped aside, allowing you access to her home. You walked in and closed the door behind yourself, locking it as you continued to lock eyes with your soon to be dinner... well...
Maybe you could wait for a little while. It would be somewhat of a shame to waste your lovely little captive. After all, she did have to do anything you asked her to... ANYTHING... What do you command her to do?
111.title: Your neighbor

choices: She's dead, what did you expect?
She's now a vampire like you are!
She's an acolyte, a permanent slave to your will!
1113.content:
She may be a real looker, but you couldn't ignore just how starved you felt. "Sit down, won't you?" You ordered her, pointing towards the couch.
"Okay." Was her vapid reply. She did exactly as you told her, moving past you and sitting on the leather couch in the living room. You noticed that she had broken eye contact while she walked but still obeyed you. You waited and watched her, making sure that she couldn't make eye contact from her position. After a few minutes Rose began to snap out of it, shaking her head and mumbling something. "Ugh... What the fuck? What happened?" She stood up woozily, rubbing her head as she struggled to move. "Ugh, why am I down here? I should be in bed!" She turned around, coming face to face with you. "Ah! What the hell are you... why... are... uh..." Her eyes went out again, going dull like the eyes of a doll.
"Huh, apparently it wears off if I break contact for too long... maybe if I kept eye contact for a longer amount of time it would last longer... Whatever, I can test that out on someone else, right now I need to eat!" You turned your attention to Rose, still standing at attention before you. You command her to tilt her head and she does so, lolling her head to right while still blankly staring at you. You giggle and dive in, sinking your teeth deeply into her exposed neck.
It was like ambrosia, the warm liquid sliding down your throat and filling you with a sense of euphoria beyond anything you had ever felt before! You kept on drinking, slurping down every drop of her life force that you could. Before you could even think of stopping the last bit of her blood slipped past you lips, rolled gracefully along your tongue, then went down beyond where you could taste. Never before had you felt more alive, every sense standing on its edge and every muscle tensed in excitement as your feast ended. You looked down at Rose, gasping for air as the fantastic taste of blood lingered in your mouth.
How's Rose doing?

115.content:
You feel you must feed, but you feel wrong feeding on a human. You ponder the idea of feeding on some nearby animals, maybe the dog next door who constantly shits in yard, or the some cows in the country, the drive isn't that far. But you know you don't have much time. Now it's starting to ache...a crazy burning feeling in the back of your throat. What to do... You stumble to the front door, wondering if it is safe to step outside with this growing hunger. Turning the handle you wonder if this is just a dream; how can this happen? Vampires aren't real!
Touching the new sharpened teeth to your lips you realize it "feels" real.
"This is crazy." you whisper to yourself.
You then step out onto the porch. Your porch light has been extinguished which makes it easier to stay hidden. You look around a bit thinking, 'who would taste good?'
"Eeeww..." you feel disgusting for this longing of human blood.
The night air feels hot on your skin. You touch your hand to your face and notice the irresistible softness of it. You are still in shock. Walking off of the porch you realize there is a man walking down the sidewalk with his dog. You contemplate the dog...no, that would be too easy. Maybe a bit of a struggle would be fun.
You begin to walk towards the man and surprisingly he doesn't hear you. Your feet on the pavement are as soft as your fingertips were on your face. You gently lag behind the man waiting for the perfect moment. Then all of a sudden he rounds on you.
"You must be new." he says. "Can you not smell me?"
Huh? What's this? You look at him a bit closer as he smiles at you. You can see his teeth, sharper than yours. Is he....he is.
"You are...."
"Yes, like you, a vampire. What did you expect? And why were you following me? Don't you think it might be a little conspicuous? Do you really want people to know about you?"
As he spoke you realized that you COULD smell him. As he moved you could swear there were roses coming from his hair, perfume from his mouth and damn...something sweet and sugary from his skin. How did you not notice that?
"I...I'm sorry. I'm so confused. This rock...it...well, I don't know what it did. But I wasn't like this." you stumble your words.
"That rock, I've seen it before. Wait! Where did you get that?! That rock is of high importance! Give it to me! Now!" he screamed.
The man suddenly lunges at you letting go of his fleeing dog, his teeth and anger bearing.

What do you do now?

Much to your surprise, you're laying on the carpet of your living room. Bizarre, considering you were actually in your bedroom before the explosion.

Only tatters or burnt clothing hang off of your ash-colored skin, a stark contrast to the unchanged room. The familiarity of the room seems almost unusual, as though something about the room is missing. There aren't any holes or other damage in the walls, which would surely be present considering what transpired.

"What the hell…" You mutter under your breath. You're glad that there aren't any repair bills in the future, but it still feels as though you've stepped into a dream, as though you're in some separate state of existence rom your being.

Those nagging ideas, however, immediately vanish as a familiar sound hits your ears. It's whistling, following a tune you yourself know well.

It's getting closer. You stare at the front door with a look of trepidation, silently pleading that it doesn't open. The whistling walks along the walkway, getting closer to the door until your guest fumbles with his keys. Your fears are confirmed as the lock clicks open, and the door cracks open as somebody enters. He's not in for over a second as he screams in horror at the instant sight of you.

It's you. A spitting double of yourself when you'd entered the door before. The two of you lock eyes, silently staring at each other in utter shock. It's as though you're looking at a reflection in a mirror, one who'd managed to escape his glass prison and selfishly walk around.

You stand only a few feet away, face-to-face with him as he stands frozen in the doorway. Without bearing any ill intent, you gently raise your hand and take a tentative step forward, as though he's a scared animal. He finally reacts to your presence and slowly raises his hand as well.
